title: Grass Length
question_text:
In a given neighborhood, residents’ grass has a mean of $3.4\text{ inches}$ with a standard deviation of $1.4\text{ inches}$, and is normally distributed.
Assuming the lawns are randomly selected, find the probability of coming across $5\text{ lawns}$ that average more than $5\text{ inches}$ long in this neighborhood.
solution:
Use the equation below to find a $z$-score of $2.56$, where:

$n = 5$
$\sigma = 1.4$
$x = 5$
$\mu = 3.4$:

$$z= \dfrac{\bar{X} - \mu}{\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}}$$

Use the standard normal table to find:

P(z > 2.56)=1−0.9948=0.0052

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
